description.narrative: 1. Project: 11982 Mosseka Lego ti Siriri - CAR Youth Peace builders#2. Project area and Country: Bozoum , Berberati and Bangui, Central African Republic (CAR)#3. Project justification:#In 2017, the CAR Government created the National Peacebuilding and Cons olidation Plan (RCPCA). However, the government capacity to implement the policy remains limited. Communities have depleted mechanisms to address the complexity of the crises, particularly concerning the growing use of religious and ethnic hate speech. Fur thermore, the situation is made worse by the erosion of traditional mechanisms of settling disputes and grievances at community level. #Young women and men represent the majority of CAR population and have been heavily impacted by the conflict both as vict ims and as perpetrators of violence. However, they lack access to local and national policy frameworks and decision-making processes. Currently 12 Local Peace and Reconciliation Committees (LPRC) established by the central government exist, but this encour aging initiative need to be still further developed and the inclusiveness of these mechanisms of diverse community voices (women, men, youth, religious leaders, authority) and perspectives is key for their effectiveness. FCA supports young people to take p art in and advocate toward the LPRCs at the local, regional and national levels to ensure young peoples perspectives and concerns are addressed and that they play an active and leading role in building and sustaining peace.#4. The main objective and expect ed results:#The main objective is to contribute to the reconstruction of the torn social fabric within the Central African youth population. The key activities consist of creating and supporting Youth Peace Clubs capacities to contribute to the reduction o f violence and conflicts in the target communities. FCA will also support the Mediator Network, a local national NGO to strengthen their program and financial capacity in order to effectively support Local Peace and Reconciliation Committees (CLPR) and the Youth Peace Clubs in the target communities in conflict prevention and resolution. #5. Rights-holders/beneficiaries: 150 direct beneficiaries (50% girls and women) and 675 indirect beneficiaries between the ages of 15 and 25, as well as local and nation al institutions and entities directly involved in peace and conflict resolution.#6. Implementing partner: FCA CAR.
